title: [Epidemiology] Wearable device study (n=15,122) measuring steps taken suggests that the burden of influenza-like illness is much greater than had previously been understood

[Neuroscience] Strange dreams might help your brain learn better. Scientists found when they suppressed REM sleep or when the dreams were less creative, the accuracy of this classifier dropped. When scientists removed non-REM sleep, the brain cortex became more sensitive to sensory blockages.
